questions.text: Putrifaction occurs at :
questions.solution:
Putrefaction begins at about 10° C, and occurs rapidly at about 37° C, the ideal temperature.
Extremes of temperature inhibits bacterial growth.

Putrefaction:

  • The chief destructive agent of Putrefaction is Clostridium welchiiQ
  • LecithinaseQ is the most important enzyme causing hemolysis, liquefaction of clots, gas formation and disintegration of tisse

Stages of putrefaction

questions.text: The oral fatal dose of potassium cyanide is:
questions.solution:
Fatal dose of Cyanide is 50 to 60 mg of pure acid; 200 to 300 mg of NaCN or KCN.

Cyanide poisoning treatment:

  • Amyl nitrite, sodium nitrite
  • Sodium thio sulphate
  • Hydroxyl cobalamine
  • Dicobalt EDTA

choices.text: Presence of soots beyond the tracheal bifurcation

questions.text: Surest proof of ante-mortem burn is :
questions.solution: Presence of carbon particles in terminal bronchioles on histological examination is absolute proof of life during the fire.

questions.text: In a female, basi-occiput fuses with basi-sphenoid at the age of ?
questions.solution: Basi occipital and basi sphenoidal union occurs at about 18 to 21 years.

questions.text: Best site of blood sample collection in autopsy is :
questions.solution:
• Most preferred site: Peripheral veins (Femoral > Axillary > sub clavian> root of aorta).
  • After organ removal: iliac veins.
  • Least preferred: Cavity blood after dissection (risk of contamination), blood from heart (risk of passive diffusion from other organs), SVC.

questions.text: In RTA, shattered aorta injury is seen in :
questions.solution: Transection of the aorta usually occurs immediately distal to the origin of left subclavian artery. There may be transverse lacerations of the intima of aorta, known as Steering wheel impact type of injury

questions.text: All of the following helps in determination of time since death, EXCEPT ?
questions.solution:
Punch drunk syndrome/Traumatic Encephalopathy/Dementia Pugilistica

  • State that occurs in old boxers due to the tiny hemorrhages in the brain.
  • The patient suffers from post traumatic psychosis, loss of memory, tremor, dysarthria.
  • Duration of boxing is more relevant than the severity of the blows

questions.text: Which of the following is not done in India ?
questions.solution:
INQUEST

  • Police inquest
  • Magistrate inquest
  • Coroner’s inquest (not in India)
  • Medical examiners inquest (not in India)

questions.text: Cholera like symptoms is produced by which of the following poisons ?
questions.solution:
Gastro enteric type is m/c form of Acute Arsenic poisoning. Initially stools are dark, stinking & bloody that turns into colourless, odourless & watery resembling rice water stools of Cholera.

Arsenic poisoning

  • Arsenious oxide or Arsenic trioxide is the most common form of arsenic used
  • Regular, long-term arsenic exposure - cutaneous carcinomas as well as internal malignancies including bronchogenic carcinoma and hepatocellular carcinoma.
  • After ingestion


  • Chronic toxicity
    • Red velvety stomach
    • Garlic odor on breath, Excessive perspiration
    • Peripheral vascular disease Gangrene of feet – Blackfoot disease
    • Brittle nails with Aldrich Mee’s lines (whitish transverse striate 1-2 mm - in the fingernails leukonychia). Also occurs in thallium poisoning.
    • Sub Endocardial hemorrhage in the left ventricle
    • Hyperpigmentation of the skin of the face or extremities - Rain drop type Pigmentation
    • Hyperkeratosis (wart like lesion) of palms and soles
    • Normochromic and normocytic anaemia
    • Symmetrical sensori-motor polyoneuropathy, often resembling Guillain-Barre syndrome
    • Arsenophagists-some people take arsenic daily as tonic or aphrodisiac and acquire tolerance

questions.text: Ophitoxemia means :
questions.solution: Ophitoxemia is poisoning by snake venom. M/c snake bites are by non-venomous snakes, M/c venomous snake bites inject inadequate venom.

questions.text: Post mortem staining before death can occur in what cases?
questions.solution: Hypostatic congestion resembling post mortem hypostasis may be seen a few hours before death in persons slowly dying of circulatory failure, Cholera, Typhus, Tuberculosis, Uraemia, Morphine, Barbiturates, CCF, deep coma & asphyxia.

choices.text: Imprisonment for 5 yrs and fine of Rs. 10,000
Imprisonment for 3 yrs and fine of Rs. 3,000
Imprisonment for 1 yrs and fine of Rs. 10,000
Imprisonment for 3 yrs and fine of Rs. 10000

questions.text: Which is the maximum sentence which a metropolitan Magistrate can pass
questions.solution: Metropolitan Magistratein a Metropolitan City(Population more than 1 million) is equivalent of First Class Judicial Magistrate.

questions.text: Never used in chemicals analysis:
questions.solution: Formalin is fixative, used for Histo pathological examination. It fixes the tissues &makes poison extraction & detection difficult.

questions.text: In limb what amount of presser applied to prevent venum migration in elapid bite?
questions.solution: Pressure of 50 to 70 mm Hg is maintained, tough to occlude lymphatic channels & superficial vessels but not tight to occlude arterial or deep venous system.

questions.text: 'Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner' sign:
questions.solution: Bedbugs bite (CIMICOSIS) in a serial row (line of bites) called Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner sign.

questions.text: Mercury poisoning is characterized by all EXCEPT:
questions.solution: KayserFleischcer ring is seen in Wilson’s disease. Chronic poisoning with copper causes picture similar to Wilson’s disease.

questions.text: CSF should be collected within
questions.solution: CSF is collected by lumbar or cisternal puncture. It is of value, if collected within 4 to 6 hours after death, but not later than 12 hours.

choices.text: Cadaveric rigidity does not appear in living people
Cadaveric rigidity appears faster in older and the young than in the middle age
Cadaveric rigidity occurs in men earlier than in the women
Cadaveric rigidity affects successively the masticatory muscles, those of the face and the neck, those of the trunk and arms and finally those of the lower limbs

questions.text: Which of the following is the Nysten's law:
questions.solution: Rigor Mortis or Cadaveric rigidity follows Proximo Distal progression in trunk, from above downwards direction in limbs.

questions.text: A person is alleged to have been dead and body is not found. Proof is produced that the same person has not been heard of for seven years by his friends and relatives, death is presumed under
questions.solution: Presumption of death is in S. 108 Indian Evidence Act; Presumption of life is in S. 107 IEA.

questions.text: Whiplash injury of spine is due to
questions.solution:
Whip Lash Injury of Spinal Cord

  • Sustained by occupant of a car
  • Sudden hyperextension & hyperflexion
  • Resulting in fatal contusion or laceration of spinal cord without fracture of spine

questions.text: Pupils alternatively contract and dilate known as hippus sign and is seen in
questions.solution:
Pupils alternately contract and dilate (hippus), but remain dilated in later stages.

ACONITE/MONK’S HOOD

  • Cardiac poison
  • Root (most toxic part) mistaken for horse radish root
  • Hippus-alternate constriction and dilation of pupil
  • Ideal homicidal poison

questions.text: Police officer has the power to summon a doctor to police station for recording a statement under
questions.solution: S. 160 Cr PC: power to summon witness, S. 161: power to examine witness, S. 162: oral statements to police need not be signed.

questions.text: Stain used to stain X chromosome
questions.solution: Quinacrine dichloride staining for Y chromosome &fluorescent Feulgen reaction using Acriflavin Schiff reagent for X chromosome.

choices.text: Impact by sharp objects with heavy base

questions.text: Stretch laceration is seen in
questions.solution:
• Over stretching of fixed skin will cause stretch laceration. Another form of stretch laceration is Tears.

 

GENERAL FEATURES of laceration:

questions.text: Correct order of putrefaction
Dead fetus never shows :
questions.solution:
Dead born usually shows Maceration, Rigor mortis or Mummification. Rarely, a child which has remained surrounded in amniotic fluid after death may get converted into Adipocere.

Adipocere (Saponification)

  • Commonly seen in bodies immersed in water or in damp warm environment
  • Gradual hydrolysis and hydrogenation of preexisting fats, to form insoluble soaps.
  • These soaps being acidic in nature inhibit the putrefactive bacteria.
  • The body fat is converted into palmitic, oleic, stearic and hydroxystearic acid by the fat splitting enzyme lecithinase, produced by clostridia group of organisms, mainly Clostridium perfringes
  • The water required for hydrolysis is obtained mainly from the body tissues.

questions.text: Sin of Gommorrah is another name for
questions.solution: Buccal coitus or Coitus per os or Sin of Gomorrah is practiced in a town called Gomorrah.

questions.text: Ladder tears seen in
questions.solution: Aortic rupture is clean cut & circular. Multiple transverse tears adjacent to main rupture is ladder tears.

questions.text: Chicken fat appearance is seen in
questions.solution:
When blood clots rapidly, soft, lump, uniformly red & moist clot called 'Red Currant Jelly';

When RBCs sediment rapidly, yellow layer of serum & fibrin, called 'Chicken fat' is formed.

questions.text: Mc naughten rule is
questions.solution: Mc Naughten's rule or Right or Wrong test or Legal test is included in S. 84 IPC.

questions.text: Punishment for issuing false certificate is
questions.solution: Issuing or signing false medical certificate (imprisonment up to seven years)

questions.text: Hostile witness is covered under IPC section
questions.solution:
Hostile witness is one who conceals part of truth or gives completely false evidence (S. 191 IPC)
Witness

  • Witnesses are of two types: (1) Common, and (2) Expert.
  • A doctor can be both a common and expert witness.
  • Hostile Witness: one who purposefully makes statement contrary to facts.
  • Perjury: Willful utterance of falsehood by a witness under oath.

questions.text: The enquiry into the circumstances of death is called
questions.solution: Inquest: Enquiry into circumstances of death; Open verdict: Case is open for lack of evidence.

questions.text: Doctor who did surgery on the wrong side of patient is punishable under section
questions.solution: Amputation of wrong finger or limb or on wrong patient is Criminal Negligence (S. 304 A IPC: Rash & negligent act causing death; S. 357 Cr PC: fine to be given as compensation to victim of negligence).

questions.text: Declaration of geneva is related with
questions.solution: Modernised version of Hippocratic Oath is the Declaration of Geneva adopted by Third General Assembly of World Medical Association, 1948 (amended in 1983).

questions.text: Exception to the rule of professional secrecy is allowed in all of the following except
questions.solution: Professional Secrecy or Confidentiality: Doctor should not discuss about illness of patient with others (even with near relatives) without the consent of patient.

questions.text: Pre suricular sinus helps in detection of
questions.solution: Pre Auricular Sulcus is more frequent, broad & deep in female innominate bone.

questions.text: Pure Aryans have which type of skull
questions.solution:
Dolicocephalic (long headed skull) with Cephalic Index 70 – 75 is seen in Dravidians, Pure Aryans, Aborigines and Negroes.

Race determination from skull

Cephalic Index =  Max. Breadth of Skull / Max.length of skull X 100

questions.text: According to federation dental the lower canine is designated as
Which of the following teeth erupt earlier in upper jaw
questions.solution: Lateral incisor erupt first in Upper jaw (quadrant) and then in Lower jaw.

questions.text: Most reliable method of identification is
questions.solution:
Herschel System or Henry - Galton System or Dermatoglyphics or Dactylography is Fingerprint testing.

Dactylography

  • First used in India: Sir William Herschel(1858). Systematised by Sir Francis Galton (1892).
  • Types: Loops (60-70%) (most common), Whorls( 25-35%), Arch (6-7%), Composite(1-2%).
  • In practice 16-20 points of comparison are accepted as proof of identity.
  • Fingerprint is absolutely individualistic (No two prints are like, even in twins)
  • Most reliable method of identification.
  • Paternity cannot be proved finger printing, but by DNA fingerprinting
  • Brain finger printing invented by Dr.Lawrence Farrel

Conditions causing permanent impairment of finger prints : Leprosy, readition, electrocution and skin grafting

questions.text: Majority of finger prints in india are
questions.solution: 60 to 70% are Loops, 25 to 35% are Whorls, 6 to 7% are Archesand 1 to 2% are Composite.

questions.text: Commonly used long bone for identification is
questions.solution: Femur is relied more for sex determination; Femur & Tibia have correlation coefficient of 0.8; Humerous & Radius have correlation of 0.7 regarding stature estimation.

questions.text: Tattooing in old decomposed body can be visualised by use of all except
questions.solution:
Faded tattoo can be visualised by Ultra Violet lamp & Magnifying glass. Infra-red rays makes old tattoo readily visible.

Gamma rays are useful in radiation measurement.

questions.text: Which of the folliwng is proof of eyes being open for few hours after death
questions.solution:
Film of debris and mucus forms yellow triangle on sclera, which becomes brown and then black (Tache Noir) within 3 to 4 hours.

Changes in EYE:

questions.text: Chocolate brown post moterm staining is seen in
questions.solution: Poisoning by Nitrites, Potassium Chlorate, Potassium Bicarbonate, Nitrobenzene, Acetanilide, Bromates and Aniline (methaemoglobinemia) develops chocolate or copper brown hypostasis.

questions.text: Major bacterial enzyme responsible for putrefaction is
questions.solution: Lecithinase produced by Clostridium welchiiis most important. This hydrolyses lecithin, which is present in all cell membranes including blood cells & thus it is also responsible for post mortem hydrolysis of blood.

choices.text: Its developed in the presence of air
It occurs in dead bodies lying in water
Body has an offensive sweat smell

questions.text: Following is not true about adipocere formation
questions.solution: Adipocere needs damp & moist environment. Presence of air is pre requisite for Mummification.

questions.text: Virchows method of organ removal is
questions.solution: Virchow's technique: Individual organs are removed one by one.

questions.text: Difference between contusion and post moterm lividity is
questions.solution: Incision shows a few oozing points at the site of severed capillaries. This blood can be easily washed away (Hypostasis).
